title: Fort Sumter National Monument: Curriculum Materials
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Curriculum Materials               Curriculum Materials      South Carolina Curriculum The South Carolina Social Studies curriculum standards are designed to serve as a benchmark to connect the history of our state and nation to what is taught in the classroom. We at Fort Sumter NM recognize the importance of these standards to learning. All of the education materials were designed with the state’s standards in mind. The attached standards are designed to allow you the opportunity to see the benefits of visiting our sites.      Fort Sumter Grade 8  (pdf, 77 KB) Grade 4  (pdf, 65 KB) Grade 3  (pdf, 75 KB)      Fort Moultrie Grade 8 (pdf, 77 KB) Grade 4 (pdf, 65 KB) Grade 3 (pdf, 75 KB)       Fourth graders learn about the 33 Star Garrison Flag at Fort Sumter Visitor Center NPS/Taormina  Other Academic Materials  Fort Sumter National Monument also offers other academic materials, lesson plans, and activities that will support students' learning experience pre-visit, during the trip, and post-visit.    American Revolution Classroom Materials:  Connect students with The Battle of Sullivan's Island and its significance in the Revolutionary War. Or learn more about the lives of soldiers and building an army.    Civil War Classroom Materials:  Learn more about the lives of soldiers or daily lives of civilians in the American Civil War. Connect students with the lives of African Americans in the War for Freedom.
